com.pokerface.pokerapi.game

Class HandRankingTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pokerface.pokerapi.game.HandRankingTest

  • public class HandRankingTest
extends java.lang.Object
    HandRankingTest checks to see if HandRanking is ranking hands correctly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HandRankingTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testFlush()
      Test to see if a flush is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testFlushTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hand contain a flush, the flush with the highest cards wins.
      void testFourOfAKind()
      Test to see if a four of a kind is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testFourOfAKindTieBreaker()
      Test to see if two hands contain a four of a kind, the hand with the highest four of a kind wins, and if they are the same (in the event of the four of a kind being in the community cards) the remaining high card is then compared, otherwise, tie.
      void testFullHouse()
      Test to see if a full house is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testFullHouseTieBreaker()
      Test to see if two hands contain a full house, the hand with the highest 3 of a kind is wins, and if it ties, then the hand with with the highest pair wins, otherwise, tie.
      void testHighCard()
      Test to see if high card hand is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testHighCardTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hands do not contain any hand, they are ranked by high card 5 times, otherwise tie.
      void testLessThanSevenCards()
      Test to see if HandRanking functions when given only one card
      void testOnePair()
      test to see if one pair is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testOnePairTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hands contain a pair, the hand that contains the higher pair wins.
      private void testRanking(TestCase<Card[],HandRanking.Type>[] testCases)
      Test a list of TestCases containing a list of Cards, and the expected HandRanking.Type that the hand should be ranked as
      void testRoyalFlush()
      Test to see if a Royal flush is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testStraight()
      Test to see if a straight is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testStraightFlush()
      Test to see if a straight flush is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testStraightFlushTieBreaker()
      Test to see if two hands contain a straight flush, the straight flush with the high card wins.
      void testStraightTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hands contain a straight, the straight with the highest card wins.
      void testThreeOfAKind()
      Test to see if a three of a kind is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testThreeOfAKindTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hands contain a 3 of a kind, the hand that contains the highest 3 of a kind wins, and if they tie, then each hand is ranked by high card twice, otherwise, tie.
      private void testTieBreaker(HandRanking.Type type, Card[] winner, Card[] looser)
      find out if given two hands, that they are the same hand (of type), and that the winner hand is always ranked above the looser hand.
      void testTwoPair()
      Test to see if two pair is correctly identified by HandRanking
      void testTwoPairTieBreaker()
      Test to see that if two hands contain two pairs, the hand that contains a higher pair wins.

        private void testRanking(TestCase<Card[],HandRanking.Type>[] testCases)

      • testStraightFlushTieBreaker

        public void testStraightFlushTieBreaker()
        Test to see if two hands contain a straight flush, the straight flush with the high card wins.

      • testFourOfAKindTieBreaker

        public void testFourOfAKindTieBreaker()
        Test to see if two hands contain a four of a kind, the hand with the highest four of a kind wins, and if they are the same (in the event of the four of a kind being in the community cards) the remaining high card is then compared, otherwise, tie.

      • testFullHouseTieBreaker

        public void testFullHouseTieBreaker()
        Test to see if two hands contain a full house, the hand with the highest 3 of a kind is wins, and if it ties, then the hand with with the highest pair wins, otherwise, tie.

      • testFlushTieBreaker

        public void testFlushTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hand contain a flush, the flush with the highest cards wins.

      • testStraightTieBreaker

        public void testStraightTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hands contain a straight, the straight with the highest card wins.

      • testThreeOfAKindTieBreaker

        public void testThreeOfAKindTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hands contain a 3 of a kind, the hand that contains the highest 3 of a kind wins, and if they tie, then each hand is ranked by high card twice, otherwise, tie.

      • testTwoPairTieBreaker

        public void testTwoPairTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hands contain two pairs, the hand that contains a higher pair wins. If both hand have the same pairs, the hand with the highest remaining card wins, otherwise, tie.

      • testOnePairTieBreaker

        public void testOnePairTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hands contain a pair, the hand that contains the higher pair wins. If both hands have the same pair, the player with the highest card wins, if they tie, tie break by high card two more times, then tie.

      • testHighCardTieBreaker

        public void testHighCardTieBreaker()
        Test to see that if two hands do not contain any hand, they are ranked by high card 5 times, otherwise tie.

      • testTieBreaker

        private void testTieBreaker(HandRanking.Type type,
                            Card[] winner,
                            Card[] looser)
        find out if given two hands, that they are the same hand (of type), and that the winner hand is always ranked above the looser hand.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of hand that both winner and looser are expected to be
        winner - the hand that should win among the two hands
        looser - the hand that should loose among the two hands

      • testLessThanSevenCards

        public void testLessThanSevenCards()
        Test to see if HandRanking functions when given only one card
